Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of the Obamacare website by comparing it to the cost of the U.S.-Mexico border wall.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or data to support the comparison between the cost of the Obamacare website and the border wall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the cost of the Obamacare website is higher than the cost of the border wall, without providing any factual basis for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Trump administration estimated the cost of the border wall to be $21.6 billion, which is significantly higher than the cost of the Obamacare website.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the claim, such as political bias or misinformation, as the source of the claim is an Instagram post by Eric Trump.
